bullets.text: Canada signals defense-spending growth won’t automatically flow to U.S. arms makers, hinting at diversification and industrial-policy preferences in procurement.
Mixed U.S. messaging at Munich and lingering backlash from Greenland threat underscore allied trust deficits and policy uncertainty for NATO and Europe.
Trump’s attack on Israel’s president highlights potential strain in U.S.-Israel political ties, adding uncertainty to Middle East diplomacy and security coordination.
Homeland Security shutdown risk raises concerns over border operations, disaster response, and cybersecurity continuity—policy brinkmanship with real economic-security spillovers.
EPA ends credit for stop-start vehicle technology, reducing incentives for incremental fuel-economy gains and shifting automaker compliance economics toward other efficiency pathways.
Japan’s China dispute is weighing on tourism and demand; GDP returned to growth but missed expectations, reinforcing a fragile rebound narrative.
White House adviser signals data-center developers may be forced to internalize grid/energy costs, potentially raising AI infrastructure capex and reshaping site selection.
Power constraints are catalyzing AI-infrastructure investment in India, including large financings for domestic compute and efficiency startups to relieve data-center bottlenecks.
Altman says India has 100M weekly active ChatGPT users, signaling outsized demand growth and intensifying competition for distribution, pricing, and localized AI products.
Bitcoin’s selloff reduced ETF inflows, but flows aren’t indicating broad capitulation—suggesting weaker momentum without full ‘crypto winter’ positioning.
Warner Bros. is considering renewed Paramount talks, highlighting continued consolidation pressure in streaming/media as scale and debt management dominate strategy.
EU bans destruction of unsold apparel and footwear, pushing retailers toward resale/recycling logistics and potentially raising compliance costs while reducing waste.
Large study finds no link between mRNA COVID vaccination in pregnancy and autism, strengthening safety evidence relevant to public-health policy and vaccine uptake.
Massive analysis suggests most statin side effects aren’t drug-caused, implying nocebo effects are substantial and adherence could improve with better patient communication.
AI identified genetic regulatory ‘control centers’ implicated in Alzheimer’s, pointing to new therapeutic targets and showing how ML is accelerating disease-mechanism discovery.
